001package squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Group;
005import squidpony.Colors;
006import squidpony.annotation.Beta;
007import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color;
008import squidpony.squidgrid.Direction;
009
010import java.util.ArrayList;
011import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
012
013/**
014 * A helper class to make using multiple SquidPanels easier.
015 * There is some useful documentation in this class' getPalette method (honestly, I don't know where else to put
016 * documentation specifically about this class' default palette). Notably, it uses libGDX Color objects instead of the
017 * AWT Color objects used elsewhere, and a convenience method is provided to convert from AWT to GDX, awtColorToGDX().
018 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 7/6/2015.
019 */
020@Beta
021public class SquidLayers extends Group {
022    protected int width;
023    protected int height;
024    protected int cellWidth;
025    protected int cellHeight;
026    protected SquidPanel backgroundPanel, lightnessPanel, foregroundPanel;
027    protected int[][] bgIndices;
028    protected int[][] lightnesses;
029    protected ArrayList<SquidPanel> extraPanels;
030    protected TextCellFactory textFactory;
031    protected ArrayList<Color> palette, lightingPalette;
032    protected boolean[][] values;
033    protected float animationDuration;
034
035    /**
036     * The pixel width of the entire map.
037     *
038     * @return
039     */
040    @Override
041    public float getWidth() {
042        return width * cellWidth;
043    }
044
045    /**
046     * The pixel height of the entire map.
047     *
048     * @return
049     */
050    @Override
051    public float getHeight() {
052        return height * cellHeight;
053    }
054
055    /**
056     * Width of the map in grid cells.
057     *
058     * @return
059     */
060    public int getGridWidth() {
061        return width;
062    }
063
064    /**
065     * Height of the map in grid cells.
066     *
067     * @return
068     */
069    public int getGridHeight() {
070        return height;
071    }
072
073    /**
074     * Width of one cell in pixels.
075     *
076     * @return
077     */
078    public int getCellWidth() {
079        return cellWidth;
080    }
081
082    /**
083     * Height of one cell in pixels.
084     *
085     * @return
086     */
087    public int getCellHeight() {
088        return cellHeight;
089    }
090
091    public float getAnimationDuration() {
092        return animationDuration;
093    }
094
095    public void setAnimationDuration(float animationDuration) {
096        this.animationDuration = animationDuration;
097    }
098
099    public TextCellFactory getTextFactory() {
100        return textFactory;
101    }
102
103    /**
104     * Gets the current palette used when no other is specified.
105     *
106     * The palette can be customized with SquidLayers.alterPalette() and SquidLayers.extendPalette() .
107     * 
108     * The default palette has colors at these elements:
109     * <ul>
110     * <li>0: Black, also used for backgrounds if not specified</li>
111     * <li>1: Off-white, used as the default foreground at times</li>
112     * <li>2: Dark gray for walls</li>
113     * <li>3: Silver gray for floors</li>
114     * <li>4: Rust brown for doors</li>
115     * <li>5: Gray-blue for water</li>
116     * <li>6: Bright orange for traps</li>
117     * <li>7: White</li>
118     * <li>8: Light gray</li>
119     * <li>9: Dark gray</li>
120     * <li>10: Light red</li>
121     * <li>11: Medium red</li>
122     * <li>12: Dark red</li>
123     * <li>13: Light orange</li>
124     * <li>14: Medium orange</li>
125     * <li>15: Dark orange</li>
126     * <li>16: Light yellow</li>
127     * <li>17: Medium yellow</li>
128     * <li>18: Dark yellow</li>
129     * <li>19: Light green</li>
130     * <li>20: Medium green</li>
131     * <li>21: Dark green</li>
132     * <li>22: Light blue-green</li>
133     * <li>23: Medium blue-green</li>
134     * <li>24: Dark blue-green</li>
135     * <li>25: Light blue</li>
136     * <li>26: Medium blue</li>
137     * <li>27: Dark blue</li>
138     * <li>28: Light purple</li>
139     * <li>29: Medium purple</li>
140     * <li>30: Dark purple</li>
141     * <li>31: Light pink</li>
142     * <li>32: Medium pink</li>
143     * <li>33: Dark pink</li>
144     * <li>34: Light gray-brown</li>
145     * <li>35: Medium gray-brown</li>
146     * <li>36: Dark gray-brown</li>
147     * <li>37: Light brown</li>
148     * <li>38: Medium brown</li>
149     * <li>39: Dark brown</li>
150     * </ul>
151     *
152     * @return the current Color ArrayList used as a default palette.
153     */
154    public ArrayList<Color> getPalette() {
155        return palette;
156    }
157
158    /**
159     * Get the lightness modifiers used for background cells as an int[][], with elements between 0 and 511, 256 as the
160     * unmodified lightness level, lower numbers meaning darker, and higher meaning lighter.
161     *
162     * @return
163     */
164    public int[][] getLightnesses() {
165        return lightnesses;
166    }
167
168    /**
169     * Get all the background color indices at once, which are probably indexed into the default palette. See the
170     * documentation for the getPalette() method in this class for more information.
171     *
172     * @return
173     */
174    public int[][] getBgIndices() {
175        return bgIndices;
176    }
177
178    /**
179     * Sets the lightness modifiers used for background cells with the int[][] passed as lightnesses. This 2D array
180     * should have elements between 0 to 511, with 256 as the unmodified lightness level, lower numbers meaning darker,
181     * and higher meaning lighter. Elements less than 0 or higher than 511 will probably cause array out-of-bounds
182     * exceptions to be thrown when this renders, so just don't do that. This doesn't validate because maps can get
183     * large, validating many cells could be expensive, and this might be called often if it's being called at all.
184     *
185     * @param lightnesses 2D array, width and height should match this class' gridWidth and gridHeight. elements must
186     *                    be between 0 and 511.
187     */
188    public void setLightnesses(int[][] lightnesses) {
189        this.lightnesses = lightnesses;
190    }
191
192    /**
193     * Set all of the background colors at once, using indexes into what is probably the default palette unless
194     * otherwise specified in the call to put(). If you want subtle variations on a color, don't add a new entry to
195     * the default palette every time if you can set the lightness differently for things with that color. Indices
196     * should correspond to the numbers in getPalette()'s documentation, or higher if you extended it.
197     *
198     * @param bgIndices 2D array, width and height should match this class' gridWidth and gridHeight.
199     */
200    public void setBgIndices(int[][] bgIndices) {
201        this.bgIndices = bgIndices;
202    }
203
204    /**
205     * Create a new SquidLayers widget with the default <b>square</b> font, 40 cells wide and high, with a size of
206     * 12x12 pixels for each cell.
207     */
208    public SquidLayers() {
209        this(40, 40);
210    }
211
212    /**
213     * Create a new SquidLayers widget with the default <b>square</b> font, the given number of cells for gridWidth
214     * and gridHeight, and 12x12 pixels for each cell.
215     *
216     * @param gridWidth  in grid cells
217     * @param gridHeight in grid cells
218     */
219    public SquidLayers(int gridWidth, int gridHeight) {
220        super();
221        initPalettes();
222        width = gridWidth;
223        height = gridHeight;
224
225        cellWidth = 12;
226        cellHeight = 12;
227
228        bgIndices = new int[width][height];
229        lightnesses = new int[width][height];
230        values = new boolean[width][height];
231
232        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
233            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
234                lightnesses[x][y] = 256;
235            }
236        }
237
238        textFactory = new TextCellFactory().defaultSquareFont().width(12).height(12).initBySize();
239
240        backgroundPanel = new SquidPanel(gridWidth, gridHeight, textFactory);
241        lightnessPanel = new SquidPanel(gridWidth, gridHeight, textFactory);
242        foregroundPanel = new SquidPanel(gridWidth, gridHeight, textFactory);
243        animationDuration = foregroundPanel.DEFAULT_ANIMATION_DURATION;
244
245        extraPanels = new ArrayList<SquidPanel>();
246
247        super.addActorAt(0, backgroundPanel);
248        super.addActorAt(1, lightnessPanel);
249        super.addActorAt(2, foregroundPanel);
250
251        this.setSize(backgroundPanel.getWidth(), backgroundPanel.getHeight());
252    }
253
254    /**
255     * Create a new SquidLayers widget with a default font (it will be square if cellWidth and cellHeight are equal, or
256     * narrow otherwise), the given number of cells for gridWidth
257     * and gridHeight, and the size in pixels for each cell given by cellWidth and cellHeight.
258     *
259     * @param gridWidth  in grid cells
260     * @param gridHeight in grid cells
261     * @param cellWidth  in pixels
262     * @param cellHeight in pixels
263     */
264    public SquidLayers(int gridWidth, int gridHeight, int cellWidth, int cellHeight) {
265        super();
266        initPalettes();
267        width = gridWidth;
268        height = gridHeight;
269
270        this.cellWidth = cellWidth;
271        this.cellHeight = cellHeight;
272
273        bgIndices = new int[width][height];
274        lightnesses = new int[width][height];
275        values = new boolean[width][height];
276        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
277            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
278                lightnesses[x][y] = 256;
279            }
280        }
281
282        textFactory = new TextCellFactory();
283        if (cellHeight == cellWidth) {
284            textFactory = textFactory.defaultSquareFont();
285        } else {
286            textFactory = textFactory.defaultNarrowFont();
287        }
288        textFactory = textFactory.width(cellWidth).height(cellHeight).initBySize();
289        backgroundPanel = new SquidPanel(gridWidth, gridHeight, textFactory);
290        lightnessPanel = new SquidPanel(gridWidth, gridHeight, textFactory);
291        foregroundPanel = new SquidPanel(gridWidth, gridHeight, textFactory);
292        animationDuration = foregroundPanel.DEFAULT_ANIMATION_DURATION;
293
294        extraPanels = new ArrayList<SquidPanel>();
295
296        super.addActorAt(0, backgroundPanel);
297        super.addActorAt(1, lightnessPanel);
298        super.addActorAt(2, foregroundPanel);
299
300        this.setSize(backgroundPanel.getWidth(), backgroundPanel.getHeight());
301    }
302
303    /**
304     * Create a new SquidLayers widget with the given path to a Font file, the given number of cells for gridWidth
305     * and gridHeight, and the size in pixels for each cell given by cellWidth and cellHeight.
306     *
307     * @param gridWidth  in grid cells
308     * @param gridHeight in grid cells
309     * @param cellWidth  in pixels
310     * @param cellHeight in pixels
311     * @param fontpath   A Font that should have been assigned a size before being passed here.
312     */
313    public SquidLayers(int gridWidth, int gridHeight, int cellWidth, int cellHeight, String fontpath) {
314        super();
315        initPalettes();
316
317        width = gridWidth;
318        height = gridHeight;
319
320        this.cellWidth = cellWidth;
321        this.cellHeight = cellHeight;
322
323        bgIndices = new int[width][height];
324        lightnesses = new int[width][height];
325        values = new boolean[width][height];
326        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
327            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
328                lightnesses[x][y] = 256;
329            }
330        }
331
332        textFactory = new TextCellFactory().font(fontpath).width(cellWidth).height(cellHeight).initBySize();
333
334        backgroundPanel = new SquidPanel(gridWidth, gridHeight, textFactory);
335        lightnessPanel = new SquidPanel(gridWidth, gridHeight, textFactory);
336        foregroundPanel = new SquidPanel(gridWidth, gridHeight, textFactory);
337        animationDuration = foregroundPanel.DEFAULT_ANIMATION_DURATION;
338
339        extraPanels = new ArrayList<SquidPanel>();
340
341        super.addActorAt(0, backgroundPanel);
342        super.addActorAt(1, lightnessPanel);
343        super.addActorAt(2, foregroundPanel);
344
345        this.setSize(backgroundPanel.getWidth(), backgroundPanel.getHeight());
346    }
347
348    public static Color awtColorToGDX(java.awt.Color original) {
349        return new Color(original.getRed() / 255f, original.getGreen() / 255f, original.getBlue() / 255f, original.getAlpha() / 255f);
350    }
351
352    private void initPalettes() {
353        palette = new ArrayList<Color>(256);
354        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.DARK_SLATE_GRAY));
355        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.CREAM));
356        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.FLATTERY_BROWN));
357        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.SILVER_GREY));
358        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.RUST));
359        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.WATER));
360        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.INTERNATIONAL_ORANGE));
361
362        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.WHITE));
363        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.LIGHT_GRAY));
364        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.DARK_GRAY));
365
366        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.RED_INCENSE));
367        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.RED));
368        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.COCHINEAL_RED));
369
370        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.PEACH_ORANGE));
371        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.ORANGE_PEEL));
372        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.TANGERINE));
373
374        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.LEMON_CHIFFON));
375        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.CORN));
376        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.GOLDEN_YELLOW));
377
378        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.TEA_GREEN));
379        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.LIME_GREEN));
380        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.PINE_GREEN));
381
382        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.BABY_BLUE));
383        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.CYAN));
384        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.BLUE_GREEN));
385
386        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.COLUMBIA_BLUE));
387        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.ROYAL_BLUE));
388        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.PERSIAN_BLUE));
389
390        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.LAVENDER_BLUE));
391        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.THIN_VIOLET));
392        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.DARK_VIOLET));
393
394        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.CARNATION_PINK));
395        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.HOT_MAGENTA));
396        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.LIGHT_MAROON));
397
398        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.TAN));
399        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.DARK_TAN));
400        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.PALE_BROWN));
401
402        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.STEAMED_CHESTNUT));
403        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.DARK_CHESTNUT));
404        palette.add(awtColorToGDX(Colors.SAPPANWOOD_INCENSE));
405
406        lightingPalette = new ArrayList<Color>(512);
407        for (int i = 0; i < 512; i++) {
408            lightingPalette.add(Color.CLEAR);
409        }
410        for (int i = 1; i < 256; i++) {
411            lightingPalette.set(256 + i, new Color(1.0f, 0xFD / 255f, 0xD8 / 255f, i / 255f));
412            lightingPalette.set(256 - i, new Color(0, 0, 0, i / 255f));
413        }
414
415    }
416
417    /**
418     * Add an extra layer on top of the foreground layer. Use putInto methods to specify the layer when adding a char (0
419     * is background, 1 is lightness modifiers, 2 is foreground, and the first call to this method creates layer 3).
420     *
421     * @return
422     */
423    public SquidLayers addExtraLayer() {
424        SquidPanel sp = new SquidPanel(width, height, textFactory);
425        super.addActor(sp);
426        extraPanels.add(sp);
427        return this;
428    }
429
430    /**
431     * Adds a color to the end of the default palette, then returns that palette.
432     * 
433     * The default palette's entries can be seen in the documentation for SquidLayers.getPalette() .
434     *
435     * @param color
436     * @return
437     */
438    public ArrayList<Color> extendPalette(Color color) {
439        palette.add(color);
440        return palette;
441    }
442
443    /**
444     * Changes a color at the specified index in the default palette, then returns that palette.
445     * 
446     * If the index is greater than or equal to the number of colors in the palette, does nothing.
447     * 
448     * The default palette's entries can be seen in the documentation for SquidLayers.getPalette() .
449     *
450     * @param index must be at least 0 and less than the length of palette (starts at length 40).
451     * @param color
452     * @return
453     */
454    public ArrayList<Color> alterPalette(int index, Color color) {
455        if (index >= 0 && index < palette.size())
456            palette.set(index, color);
457
458        return palette;
459    }
460
461    /**
462     * Place a char c into the foreground at position x, y, with the default color.
463     *
464     * @param x in grid cells.
465     * @param y in grid cells.
466     * @param c a character to be drawn in the foreground
467     */
468    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c) {
469        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c);
470        values[x][y] = true;
471        return this;
472    }
473
474    /**
475     * Place a char c into the foreground, with a foreground color specified by an index into the default palette.
476     *
477     * @param x               in grid cells.
478     * @param y               in grid cells.
479     * @param c               a character to be drawn in the foreground
480     * @param foregroundIndex int index into the default palette for the char being drawn
481     */
482    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c, int foregroundIndex) {
483        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foregroundIndex, palette);
484        values[x][y] = true;
485        return this;
486    }
487
488    /**
489     * Place a char c into the foreground, with a foreground color specified by an index into the default palette, and a
490     * background color specified in the same way.
491     *
492     * @param x               in grid cells.
493     * @param y               in grid cells.
494     * @param c               a character to be drawn in the foreground
495     * @param foregroundIndex int index into the default palette for the char being drawn
496     * @param backgroundIndex int index into the default palette for the background
497     */
498    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c, int foregroundIndex, int backgroundIndex) {
499        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foregroundIndex, palette);
500        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, backgroundIndex, palette);
501        values[x][y] = true;
502        return this;
503    }
504
505    /**
506     * Place a char c into the foreground, with a foreground color specified by an index into the default palette, a
507     * background color specified in the same way, and a lightness variation for the background (0 is no change, 100 is
508     * very bright, -100 is very dark, anything past -150 or 150 will make the background almost fully black or white).
509     *
510     * @param x                   in grid cells.
511     * @param y                   in grid cells.
512     * @param c                   a character to be drawn in the foreground
513     * @param foregroundIndex     int index into the default palette for the char being drawn
514     * @param backgroundIndex     int index into the default palette for the background
515     * @param backgroundLightness int between -255 and 255 , lower numbers are darker, higher lighter.
516     */
517    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c, int foregroundIndex, int backgroundIndex, int backgroundLightness) {
518        backgroundLightness = clamp(backgroundLightness, -255, 255);
519        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foregroundIndex, palette);
520        values[x][y] = true;
521        lightnesses[x][y] = 256 + backgroundLightness;
522
523        lightnessPanel.put(x, y, 256 + backgroundLightness, lightingPalette);
524        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, backgroundIndex, palette);
525        return this;
526    }
527
528    /**
529     * Place a char c into the foreground, with a foreground color specified by an index into alternatePalette, a
530     * background color specified in the same way, and a lightness variation for the background (0 is no change, 100 is
531     * very bright, -100 is very dark, anything past -150 or 150 will make the background almost fully black or white).
532     *
533     * @param x                   in grid cells.
534     * @param y                   in grid cells.
535     * @param c                   a character to be drawn in the foreground
536     * @param alternatePalette    an alternate Color ArrayList for both foreground and background
537     * @param foregroundIndex     int index into alternatePalette for the char being drawn
538     * @param backgroundIndex     int index into alternatePalette for the background
539     * @param backgroundLightness int between -255 and 255 , lower numbers are darker, higher lighter.
540     */
541    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c, ArrayList<Color> alternatePalette, int foregroundIndex, int backgroundIndex, int backgroundLightness) {
542        backgroundLightness = clamp(backgroundLightness, -255, 255);
543        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foregroundIndex, alternatePalette);
544        values[x][y] = true;
545        lightnesses[x][y] = 256 + backgroundLightness;
546
547        lightnessPanel.put(x, y, 256 + backgroundLightness, lightingPalette);
548        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, backgroundIndex, alternatePalette);
549        return this;
550    }
551
552    /**
553     * Place a char c into the foreground, with a foreground color specified by an index into alternatePalette, a
554     * background color specified in the same way, and a lightness variation for the background (0 is no change, 100 is
555     * very bright, -100 is very dark, anything past -150 or 150 will make the background almost fully black or white).
556     *
557     * @param x                   in grid cells.
558     * @param y                   in grid cells.
559     * @param c                   a character to be drawn in the foreground
560     * @param foregroundIndex     int index into alternatePalette for the char being drawn
561     * @param fgPalette           an alternate Color ArrayList for the foreground; can be null to use the default.
562     * @param backgroundIndex     int index into alternatePalette for the background
563     * @param bgPalette           an alternate Color ArrayList for the background; can be null to use the default.
564     * @param backgroundLightness int between -255 and 255 , lower numbers are darker, higher lighter.
565     */
566    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c, int foregroundIndex, ArrayList<Color> fgPalette, int backgroundIndex, ArrayList<Color> bgPalette, int backgroundLightness) {
567        backgroundLightness = clamp(backgroundLightness, -255, 255);
568        if (fgPalette == null) fgPalette = palette;
569        if (bgPalette == null) bgPalette = palette;
570        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foregroundIndex, fgPalette);
571        values[x][y] = true;
572        lightnesses[x][y] = 256 + backgroundLightness;
573
574        lightnessPanel.put(x, y, 256 + backgroundLightness, lightingPalette);
575        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, backgroundIndex, bgPalette);
576        return this;
577    }
578
579
580    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char[][] c) {
581        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c);
582        for (int i = x; i < c.length && i < width; i++) {
583            for (int j = y; j < c[i].length && j < height; j++) {
584                values[i][j] = true;
585            }
586        }
587        return this;
588    }
589
590    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char[][] c, int[][] foregroundIndex) {
591        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foregroundIndex, palette);
592        for (int i = x; i < c.length && i < width; i++) {
593            for (int j = y; j < c[i].length && j < height; j++) {
594                values[i][j] = true;
595            }
596        }
597        return this;
598    }
599
600    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c[][], int[][] foregroundIndex, int[][] backgroundIndex) {
601        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foregroundIndex, palette);
602        for (int i = x; i < c.length && i < width; i++) {
603            for (int j = y; j < c[i].length && j < height; j++) {
604                values[i][j] = true;
605            }
606        }
607        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, backgroundIndex, palette);
608        return this;
609    }
610
611    /**
612     * Place a char[][] c into the foreground, with a foreground color specified by an index into alternatePalette, a
613     * background color specified in the same way, and a lightness variation for the background (0 is no change, 100 is
614     * very bright, -100 is very dark, anything past -150 or 150 will make the background almost fully black or white).
615     *
616     * @param x                   in grid cells.
617     * @param y                   in grid cells.
618     * @param c                   char[][] to be drawn in the foreground starting from x, y
619     * @param foregroundIndex     int[][] of indices into the default palette for the char being drawn
620     * @param backgroundIndex     int[][] of indices into the default palette for the background
621     * @param backgroundLightness int[][] with elements between -255 and 255 , lower darker, higher lighter.
622     */
623    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char[][] c, int[][] foregroundIndex, int[][] backgroundIndex, int[][] backgroundLightness) {
624        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foregroundIndex, palette);
625        for (int i = x; i < width && i < backgroundLightness.length; i++) {
626            for (int j = y; j < height && j < backgroundLightness[i].length; j++) {
627                lightnesses[i][j] = 256 + clamp(backgroundLightness[i][j], -255, 255);
628                values[i][j] = true;
629            }
630        }
631        lightnessPanel.put(0, 0, lightnesses, lightingPalette);
632        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, backgroundIndex, palette);
633        return this;
634    }
635
636    /**
637     * Place a char c into the foreground, with a foreground color specified by an index into alternatePalette, a
638     * background color specified in the same way, and a lightness variation for the background (0 is no change, 100 is
639     * very bright, -100 is very dark, anything past -150 or 150 will make the background almost fully black or white).
640     *
641     * @param x                   in grid cells.
642     * @param y                   in grid cells.
643     * @param c                   char[][] to be drawn in the foreground starting from x, y
644     * @param alternatePalette    an alternate Color ArrayList for both foreground and background
645     * @param foregroundIndex     int[][] of indices into alternatePalette for the char being drawn
646     * @param backgroundIndex     int[][] of indices into alternatePalette for the background
647     * @param backgroundLightness int[][] with elements between -255 and 255 , lower darker, higher lighter.
648     */
649    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char[][] c, ArrayList<Color> alternatePalette, int[][] foregroundIndex, int[][] backgroundIndex, int[][] backgroundLightness) {
650
651        if (alternatePalette == null) alternatePalette = palette;
652        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foregroundIndex, alternatePalette);
653        for (int i = x; i < width && i < backgroundLightness.length; i++) {
654            for (int j = y; j < height && j < backgroundLightness[i].length; j++) {
655                lightnesses[i][j] = 256 + clamp(backgroundLightness[i][j], -255, 255);
656                values[i][j] = true;
657            }
658        }
659        lightnessPanel.put(0, 0, lightnesses, lightingPalette);
660        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, backgroundIndex, alternatePalette);
661        return this;
662    }
663
664    /**
665     * Place a char c into the foreground, with a foreground color specified by an index into alternatePalette, a
666     * background color specified in the same way, and a lightness variation for the background (0 is no change, 100 is
667     * very bright, -100 is very dark, anything past -150 or 150 will make the background almost fully black or white).
668     *
669     * @param x                   in grid cells.
670     * @param y                   in grid cells.
671     * @param c                   char[][] to be drawn in the foreground starting from x, y
672     * @param foregroundIndex     int[][] of indices into fgPalette for the char being drawn
673     * @param fgPalette           an alternate Color ArrayList for the foreground; can be null to use the default.
674     * @param backgroundIndex     int[][] of indices into bgPalette for the background
675     * @param bgPalette           an alternate Color ArrayList for the background; can be null to use the default.
676     * @param backgroundLightness int[][] with elements between -255 and 255 , lower darker, higher lighter.
677     */
678    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char[][] c, int[][] foregroundIndex, ArrayList<Color> fgPalette, int[][] backgroundIndex, ArrayList<Color> bgPalette, int[][] backgroundLightness) {
679        if (fgPalette == null) fgPalette = palette;
680        if (bgPalette == null) bgPalette = palette;
681        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foregroundIndex, fgPalette);
682        for (int i = x; i < width && i < backgroundLightness.length; i++) {
683            for (int j = y; j < height && j < backgroundLightness[i].length; j++) {
684                lightnesses[i][j] = 256 + clamp(backgroundLightness[i][j], -255, 255);
685                values[i][j] = true;
686            }
687        }
688        lightnessPanel.put(0, 0, lightnesses, lightingPalette);
689        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, backgroundIndex, bgPalette);
690        return this;
691    }
692
693    /**
694     * Place a char c[][] into the specified layer, with a color specified by an index into alternatePalette.
695     *
696     * @param layer 0 for background, 1 for lightness, 2 for foreground, 3 or higher for extra layers added on.
697     * @param x     in grid cells.
698     * @param y     in grid cells.
699     * @param c     char[][] to be drawn in the foreground starting from x, y
700     */
701    public SquidLayers putInto(int layer, int x, int y, char c) {
702        SquidPanel p = backgroundPanel;
703        switch (layer) {
704            case 0:
705                break;
706            case 1:
707                p = lightnessPanel;
708                break;
709            case 2:
710                p = foregroundPanel;
711                break;
712            default:
713                p = extraPanels.get(layer - 3);
714        }
715        p.put(x, y, c);
716        values[x][y] = true;
717        return this;
718    }
719
720    /**
721     * Place a char c[][] into the specified layer, with a color specified by an index into the default palette.
722     *
723     * @param layer      0 for background, 1 for lightness, 2 for foreground, 3 or higher for extra layers added on.
724     * @param x          in grid cells.
725     * @param y          in grid cells.
726     * @param c          char[][] to be drawn in the foreground starting from x, y
727     * @param colorIndex int[][] of indices into alternatePalette for the char being drawn
728     */
729    public SquidLayers putInto(int layer, int x, int y, char c, int colorIndex) {
730        SquidPanel p = backgroundPanel;
731        switch (layer) {
732            case 0:
733                break;
734            case 1:
735                p = lightnessPanel;
736                break;
737            case 2:
738                p = foregroundPanel;
739                break;
740            default:
741                p = extraPanels.get(layer - 3);
742        }
743        p.put(x, y, c, colorIndex, palette);
744        values[x][y] = true;
745        return this;
746    }
747
748    /**
749     * Place a char c[][] into the specified layer, with a color specified by an index into alternatePalette.
750     *
751     * @param layer            0 for background, 1 for lightness, 2 for foreground, 3 or higher for extra layers added on.
752     * @param x                in grid cells.
753     * @param y                in grid cells.
754     * @param c                char[][] to be drawn in the foreground starting from x, y
755     * @param alternatePalette an alternate Color ArrayList for both foreground and background
756     * @param colorIndex       int[][] of indices into alternatePalette for the char being drawn
757     */
758    public SquidLayers putInto(int layer, int x, int y, char c, ArrayList<Color> alternatePalette, int colorIndex) {
759        SquidPanel p = backgroundPanel;
760        switch (layer) {
761            case 0:
762                break;
763            case 1:
764                p = lightnessPanel;
765                break;
766            case 2:
767                p = foregroundPanel;
768                break;
769            default:
770                p = extraPanels.get(layer - 3);
771        }
772        if (alternatePalette == null) alternatePalette = palette;
773        p.put(x, y, c, colorIndex, alternatePalette);
774        values[x][y] = true;
775        return this;
776    }
777
778    /**
779     * Place a char c[][] into the specified layer, with a color specified by an index into alternatePalette.
780     *
781     * @param layer 0 for background, 1 for lightness, 2 for foreground, 3 or higher for extra layers added on.
782     * @param x     in grid cells.
783     * @param y     in grid cells.
784     * @param c     char[][] to be drawn in the foreground starting from x, y
785     */
786    public SquidLayers putInto(int layer, int x, int y, char[][] c) {
787        SquidPanel p = backgroundPanel;
788        switch (layer) {
789            case 0:
790                break;
791            case 1:
792                p = lightnessPanel;
793                break;
794            case 2:
795                p = foregroundPanel;
796                break;
797            default:
798                p = extraPanels.get(layer - 3);
799        }
800        p.put(x, y, c);
801        for (int i = x; i < c.length && i < width; i++) {
802            for (int j = y; j < c[i].length && j < height; j++) {
803                values[i][j] = true;
804            }
805        }
806        return this;
807    }
808
809    /**
810     * Place a char c[][] into the specified layer, with a color specified by an index into the default palette.
811     *
812     * @param layer      0 for background, 1 for lightness, 2 for foreground, 3 or higher for extra layers added on.
813     * @param x          in grid cells.
814     * @param y          in grid cells.
815     * @param c          char[][] to be drawn in the foreground starting from x, y
816     * @param colorIndex int[][] of indices into alternatePalette for the char being drawn
817     */
818    public SquidLayers putInto(int layer, int x, int y, char[][] c, int[][] colorIndex) {
819        SquidPanel p = backgroundPanel;
820        switch (layer) {
821            case 0:
822                break;
823            case 1:
824                p = lightnessPanel;
825                break;
826            case 2:
827                p = foregroundPanel;
828                break;
829            default:
830                p = extraPanels.get(layer - 3);
831        }
832        p.put(x, y, c, colorIndex, palette);
833        for (int i = x; i < c.length && i < width; i++) {
834            for (int j = y; j < c[i].length && j < height; j++) {
835                values[i][j] = true;
836            }
837        }
838        return this;
839    }

874
875    /**
876     * Put a string at the given x, y position, using the default color.
877     *
878     * @param x in grid cells.
879     * @param y in grid cells.
880     * @param s the string to print
881     * @return this, for chaining
882     */
883    public SquidLayers putString(int x, int y, String s) {
884        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, s);
885        return this;
886    }
887
888    /**
889     * Put a string at the given x, y position, with the given index for foreground color that gets looked up in the
890     * default palette.
891     *
892     * @param x               in grid cells.
893     * @param y               in grid cells.
894     * @param s               the string to print
895     * @param foregroundIndex
896     * @return this, for chaining
897     */
898    public SquidLayers putString(int x, int y, String s, int foregroundIndex) {
899        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, s, palette.get(foregroundIndex));
900        return this;
901    }
902
903    /**
904     * Put a string at the given x, y position, with the given indices for foreground and background color that look up
905     * their index in the default palette.
906     *
907     * @param x               in grid cells.
908     * @param y               in grid cells.
909     * @param s               the string to print
910     * @param foregroundIndex
911     * @param backgroundIndex
912     * @return this, for chaining
913     */
914    public SquidLayers putString(int x, int y, String s, int foregroundIndex, int backgroundIndex) {
915        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, s, palette.get(foregroundIndex));
916        for (int i = x; i < s.length() && i < width; i++) {
917            backgroundPanel.put(i, y, palette.get(backgroundIndex));
918        }
919        return this;
920    }
921
922    /**
923     * Put a string at the given x, y position, with the given indices for foreground and background color that look up
924     * their index in alternatePalette.
925     *
926     * @param x                in grid cells.
927     * @param y                in grid cells.
928     * @param s                the string to print
929     * @param alternatePalette
930     * @param foregroundIndex
931     * @param backgroundIndex
932     * @return this, for chaining
933     */
934    public SquidLayers putString(int x, int y, String s, ArrayList<Color> alternatePalette, int foregroundIndex, int backgroundIndex) {
935        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, s, alternatePalette.get(foregroundIndex));
936        for (int i = x; i < s.length() && i < width; i++) {
937            backgroundPanel.put(i, y, alternatePalette.get(backgroundIndex));
938        }
939        return this;
940    }
941
942    /**
943     * A utility method that draws a 1-cell-wide black box around the text you request (as s) and replaces the contents
944     * of anything that was below or adjacent to the string's new position. Useful for message boxes.
945     *
946     * @param x in grid cells.
947     * @param y in grid cells.
948     * @param s the string to print inside the box
949     * @return this, for chaining
950     */
951    public SquidLayers putBoxedString(int x, int y, String s) {
952        if (y > 0 && y + 1 < height && x > 0 && x + 1 < width) {
953            for (int j = y - 1; j < y + 2 && j < height; j++) {
954                for (int i = x - 1; i < s.length() + x + 2 && i < width; i++) {
955                    foregroundPanel.put(i, j, ' ');
956                    backgroundPanel.put(i, j, palette.get(9));
957                    lightnesses[i][j] = -255;
958                    lightnessPanel.put(i, j, 1, lightingPalette);
959                }
960            }
961        }
962        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, s, palette.get(1));
963
964        return this;
965    }
966
967    /**
968     * Change the lightness for the background of the cell at x, y (0 is no change, 100 is
969     * very bright, -100 is very dark, anything past -150 or 150 will make the background almost fully black or white).
970     *
971     * @param x                   in grid cells.
972     * @param y                   in grid cells.
973     * @param lightness int between -255 and 255 , lower numbers are darker, higher lighter.
974     */
975    public SquidLayers highlight(int x, int y, int lightness) {
976        lightness = clamp(lightness, -255, 255);
977        lightnesses[x][y] = 256 + lightness;
978
979        lightnessPanel.put(x, y, 256 + lightness, lightingPalette);
980        return this;
981    }
982    /**
983     * Change the lightness for the background of the cell at x, y (0 is no change, 100 is
984     * very bright, -100 is very dark, anything past -150 or 150 will make the background almost fully black or white).
985     *
986     * @param x                   in grid cells.
987     * @param y                   in grid cells.
988     * @param lightness int[][] with elements between -255 and 255 , lower numbers are darker, higher lighter.
989     */
990    public SquidLayers highlight(int x, int y, int[][] lightness) {
991        for (int i = 0; i < lightness.length && x + i < width; i++) {
992            for (int j = 0; j < lightness[i].length && y + j < height; j++) {
993                lightness[i][j] = 256 + clamp(lightness[i][j], -255, 255);
994                lightnesses[x+i][y+j] = lightness[i][j];
995            }
996        }
997        lightnessPanel.put(x, y, lightness, lightingPalette);
998        return this;
999    }
1000    /**
1001     * Very basic check to see if something was rendered at the x,y cell requested. (usually this only checks the
1002     * foreground) If blank, false, otherwise true.
1003     *
1004     * @param x in grid cells.
1005     * @param y in grid cells.
1006     * @return
1007     */
1008    public boolean hasValue(int x, int y) {
1009        return values[x][y];
1010    }
1011
1012    /**
1013     * Clear one cell at position x, y of  its foreground contents.
1014     * 
1015     * You may be looking for the erase() method, which erases all panels and all cells.
1016     *
1017     * @param x in grid cells
1018     * @param y in grid cells
1019     * @return
1020     */
1021    public SquidLayers clear(int x, int y) {
1022        foregroundPanel.clear(x, y);
1023        values[x][y] = false;
1024        return this;
1025    }
1026
1027    /**
1028     * Erase everything visible in all cells or all layers.  This can be expensive to do in a traditional game loop,
1029     * since Swing is not meant for that at all.
1030     *
1031     * @return this, for chaining
1032     */
1033    public SquidLayers erase() {
1034        foregroundPanel.erase();
1035        lightnessPanel.erase();
1036        backgroundPanel.erase();
1037        for (SquidPanel sp : extraPanels) {
1038            sp.erase();
1039        }
1040        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
1041            for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
1042                values[i][j] = false;
1043            }
1044        }
1045        return this;
1046    }
1047
1048    public SquidLayers bump(int x, int y, int layer, Direction dir, float duration) {
1049        SquidPanel p = foregroundPanel;
1050        switch (layer) {
1051            case 0:
1052                p = backgroundPanel;
1053                break;
1054            case 1:
1055                p = lightnessPanel;
1056                break;
1057            case 2:
1058                break;
1059            default:
1060                p = extraPanels.get(layer - 3);
1061        }
1062        if (duration < 0)
1063            duration = animationDuration;
1064        p.bump(x, y, dir, duration);
1065        return this;
1066    }
1067    public SquidLayers bump(AnimatedEntity ae, int layer, Direction dir, float duration) {
1068        SquidPanel p = foregroundPanel;
1069        switch (layer) {
1070            case 0:
1071                p = backgroundPanel;
1072                break;
1073            case 1:
1074                p = lightnessPanel;
1075                break;
1076            case 2:
1077                break;
1078            default:
1079                p = extraPanels.get(layer - 3);
1080        }
1081        if (duration < 0)
1082            duration = animationDuration;
1083        p.bump(ae, dir, duration);
1084        return this;
1085    }
1086
1087    public SquidLayers bump(int x, int y, Direction dir) {
1088        return bump(x, y, 2, dir, -1);
1089    }
1090    public SquidLayers bump(AnimatedEntity ae, Direction dir) {
1091        return bump(ae, 2, dir, -1);
1092    }

1094    public SquidLayers slide(AnimatedEntity ae, int endX, int endY, int layer, float duration) {
1095        SquidPanel p = foregroundPanel;
1096        switch (layer) {
1097            case 0:
1098                p = backgroundPanel;
1099                break;
1100            case 1:
1101                p = lightnessPanel;
1102                break;
1103            case 2:
1104                break;
1105            default:
1106                p = extraPanels.get(layer - 3);
1107        }
1108        if (duration < 0)
1109            duration = animationDuration;
1110        p.slide(ae, endX, endY, duration);
1111        return this;
1112    }
1113    public SquidLayers slide(int x, int y, int endX, int endY, int layer, float duration) {
1114        SquidPanel p = foregroundPanel;
1115        switch (layer) {
1116            case 0:
1117                p = backgroundPanel;
1118                break;
1119            case 1:
1120                p = lightnessPanel;
1121                break;
1122            case 2:
1123                break;
1124            default:
1125                p = extraPanels.get(layer - 3);
1126        }
1127        if (duration < 0)
1128            duration = animationDuration;
1129        p.slide(x, y, endX, endY, duration);
1130        return this;
1131    }

1134        return slide(x, y, endX, endY, 2, -1);
1135    }

1137        return slide(ae, endX, endY, 2, -1);
1138    }

1230
1231    public boolean hasActiveAnimations() {
1232        if (foregroundPanel.hasActiveAnimations())
1233            return true;
1234        if (backgroundPanel.hasActiveAnimations())
1235            return true;
1236        if (lightnessPanel.hasActiveAnimations())
1237            return true;
1238        for (SquidPanel panel : extraPanels) {
1239            if (panel.hasActiveAnimations())
1240                return true;
1241        }
1242        return false;
1243    }
1244
1245    public AnimatedEntity animateActor(int x, int y, char c, Color color, int layer) {
1246        SquidPanel p = foregroundPanel;
1247        switch (layer) {
1248            case 0:
1249                p = backgroundPanel;
1250                break;
1251            case 1:
1252                p = lightnessPanel;
1253                break;
1254            case 2:
1255                break;
1256            default:
1257                p = extraPanels.get(layer - 3);
1258        }
1259        return p.animateActor(x, y, c, color);
1260    }
1261
1262    public AnimatedEntity animateActor(int x, int y, char c, Color color) {
1263        return foregroundPanel.animateActor(x, y, c, color);
1264    }

1266        return foregroundPanel.animateActor(x, y, doubleWidth, c, color);
1267    }

1343    public LinkedHashSet<AnimatedEntity> getAnimatedEntities(int layer) {
1344        SquidPanel p = foregroundPanel;
1345        switch (layer) {
1346            case 0:
1347                p = backgroundPanel;
1348                break;
1349            case 1:
1350                p = lightnessPanel;
1351                break;
1352            case 2:
1353                break;
1354            default:
1355                p = extraPanels.get(layer - 3);
1356        }
1357        return p.getAnimatedEntities();
1358    }

1384        @Override
1385    public void draw(Batch batch, float parentAlpha) {
1386        super.draw(batch, parentAlpha);
1387    }
1388
1389    public void drawActor(Batch batch, float parentAlpha, AnimatedEntity ae, int layer)
1390    {
1391        SquidPanel p = foregroundPanel;
1392        switch (layer) {
1393            case 0:
1394                p = backgroundPanel;
1395                break;
1396            case 1:
1397                p = lightnessPanel;
1398                break;
1399            case 2:
1400                break;
1401            default:
1402                p = extraPanels.get(layer - 3);
1403        }
1404        p.drawActor(batch, parentAlpha, ae);
1405    }
1406    public void drawActor(Batch batch, float parentAlpha, AnimatedEntity ae)
1407    {
1408        foregroundPanel.drawActor(batch, parentAlpha, ae);
1409    }

1411
1412    private int clamp(int x, int min, int max)
1413    {
1414        return Math.min(Math.max(min, x), max);
1415    }
1416
1417}
